website_summaries.verdict: In spite of its limitations, it's an affordable, reliable multimeter that accurately reads volts/amps/watts and has a capacity for various devices.
pros: Earns praise for accuracy and bright digital display
cons: Not as versatile as other multimeters

customer_reviews.title: It all depends on how it is held
customer_reviews.text: Pitiful that such devices cannot be made to function after they are shipped. Faulty connecting cable. Move the meter slightly and the electrical connection is lost.
customer_reviews.author: doctor don

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived and is very inaccurate. The reading is all over the place. It showed everything I plug it to to pull 1 amp. It didn't matter if it's a wall plug or a power bank. I've used diffenrent wire for both IOS and Android and it still showed the same amps. Tried multiple times with both usb plugs. Would love to receive a properly working 1 but I guess I received a dud.
customer_reviews.author: John Eston

customer_reviews.title: Everybody got cables.  But....How good are they?
customer_reviews.text: Amaze-balls product! First off, now you know if your cord is good or if it sucks. And sucky cables can go to sucky/slow-charging electronics. Leaving the best cables for phones and tablets. Second you can tell of that one device ... You know the one ... the one your kid / wife / self accidentally ripped the cable out, damaging it, forever making it hard to charge... That one! You can tell out it's charging now. Find the sweet charging-spot on your devices!! Third you can tell of that one extra battery, the cheap one from corona-country, has as many mAh as it says it does (hint: they rarely ever do) Just gave my last one away so buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: WRONG READINGS-FALSE READINGS
customer_reviews.text: Other than the totally wrong readings this unit has signs of use. used tabacco particles and other things came out with its protective case. The screen shot shows the correct readings of the charging adapter used and reading taken after Droke's false readings. Volts and amps totally off. This is a shame because it wastes so much time of the buyer just to put up the proof after taking pictures transferring from phone to laptop and Windows 10 has major issues for some hardware to work. Wasted two hours to put facts as pictures here.
customer_reviews.author: R. K

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Connection Cable
customer_reviews.text: As another reviewer has noted, the input cable for the device can be faulty. When I move the device even slightly the readings jump all over the place and I have narrowed it down to the cable that goes from the device to the input source. There is a faulty connection somewhere inside that cable. Therefore, it makes this item useless. Too bad I didn’t discover this before the return period expired.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Bad USB port design.
customer_reviews.text: At first, it was working good and was loving it. However, not long after Output II stopped working and upon close examination of the port, I discovered that one of the four contact pins remained stuck depressed, so it cannot make contacts with USB male insertions. It won't be long before the other port fails as well. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Wega

customer_reviews.title: Drok USB 2.0 Digital Tester with 7 Modes
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality USB Digital Tester by Drok. I am not affiliated with this company nor am I getting paid for this review. I have purchased this item a year ago and with no problems and accurate readings, I decided to order 2 more to use on my Ravpower 4 panel 3 USB Solar charger. It takes out the guess work to see Digital output of Battery banks and Solar panels. This is a 7 MODES MONITOR *C(capacitance) *VA(Voltage and Amps) *P(Power) *VA+C *VA+P *C+P *VA+C+P Drok products are of good quality and price. I also purchased their 12v to 6v step down with awesome results. Would recommend 👍.
customer_reviews.author: Ika strip

customer_reviews.title: Great device, terrible manual
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little box -- it does exactly what it's supposed to do in a small package at a low price. I'd give the device five++ stars. The instructions, however are terrible -- strange and incorrect vocabulary to the point that I don't really understand everything that it is capable of. I certainly recommend it to all and would buy it again, but I do hope they fix the manual soon. Note, by the way, that I gave five stars to "charging power" above -- it does not actually do any charging, but simply meters voltage, current, power, and energy passing through it from a charger to a device.
customer_reviews.author: JLW

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This little meter worked perfectly for my application. I have it between a couple of usb solar charging panels and a power bank; it gives me a reading all day long on how much power is coming through from the panels, as well as how much cumulative power is added to the power bank each day. Works perfectly, and the different displays are easy enough to toggle through. It also works well to compare different USB cables and how well they can pass through a charge. Thanks to this little meter, I now have a large bag of "not-so-good" cables and a small bag of decent cables.
customer_reviews.author: mostlyharmlessx

customer_reviews.title: Helps monitor if a device is charging and at what amperage.
customer_reviews.text: This device helps me to check the performance of a USB charger, and the charging rate of devices attached to it. I had a charger that indicated it was operating normally, but devices attached to it where charging at a very slow rate. With this meter in line it became readily apparent that the charger was delivering the correct voltage (5V), but the amps transfer rate was less than 0.1. It should have been capable of delivering 1 to 1.5 amps.
customer_reviews.author: Astro57

customer_reviews.title: Decent meter
customer_reviews.text: To be honest it does not do much; measure the current going through when you plug something in. The numbers are big and easy to read; there is a button to change mode, but the info displayed in these modes are neither accurate nor useful for me. In few occasions the device connected was not charging because this device was affecting the charging circuit; and if you use it for USB measurements on a computer; keep in mind that there is no data channel; so the computer won't recognize what you plug in; so use it only to measure current
customer_reviews.author: CFTop Contributor: Star Trek

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for your devices
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so this is not a paid review . First I have to say being able to check our multiple charging cables for proper operation is a big plus . Second I can check the charging of our devices , because over time batteries age and take longer to charge and this device if you make periodically check your device charging current can show the health of your battery . Third this removes all doubt about " Is this cable working ? ,Or is it my charger ". I don't use it everyday it's just another tool in my tool box to keep our numerous cords and devices operating .
customer_reviews.author: Longbow

customer_reviews.title: Great simple USB port tester
customer_reviews.text: So glad I found this little device. I've been hoping to find something for testing USB ports, and this is about as close as it gets. Capable of 10A for a very short period of time, but should be able to measure up to 3A fairly well. Adds 2 USB ports to test your devices. Had a touchscreen damaged by rain, and was able to tell when the ports were working again.. This is a good quick way to test your port, although I would've like to seen a logic-light per wire to show activity as well. Very easily portable, and now with my traveling tool set.
customer_reviews.author: aj4mq

customer_reviews.title: "MUST HAVE" for < 50W portal solar panels !!
customer_reviews.text: Originally I bought it to verify my new 28w portal solar panel performance then I forgot it. Recently wondering if my power bank is near full or real full, I realized that "position/angles of solar panel" especially the small portable ones makes a huge differences in charging currents: I have seen an easy 0.6A to 1.6A jump in adjusting angles. This is very easy to use and provides stable/clear readings. A MUST HAVE for charging efficiency in my own opinion !.
customer_reviews.author: LiamCA

customer_reviews.title: USB simultanously, Current, Voltage measurements.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, informs you whether or not your actually drawing any current to know whether or not your cable, phone, or block are working. Use this to identify the need for a cleaning to your phone input. Save a visit to the repair facility. Great trouble shooting device, well needed with so many standard USB devices known and available today. Invaluable trouble shooting device. Displays current and voltage. With a simple multiplication, calculation. It gives you power consumption. Great tool it really makes sense to own one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Greatdane

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Device. Confirms that the USB port is working!
customer_reviews.text: With so many different phones, chargers and computers and other USB powered devices around here, I had not always been sure that they all had been charging at a good rate, or were even connected properly. I have found that using this device makes me confident that I am actually connected, the USB port power source is working correctly and good charging current is being supplied. I was very pleased with the device, and bought a second one. It eliminates a lot of USB head-scratching when something doesn't seem quite right between USB port and external devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dublin73

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Got this tool to check the different adopters output, I have around for my tablets, cell phones, and other devices. Great tool to inspecting, if an adopter is malfunctioning and not outputting the right ampere charge. Also, useful to make sure you don't mix low output charger with the higher out charger, which our kids love to switch on us, when they lost track of their charging adopters
customer_reviews.author: La Bear

customer_reviews.title: Better than the more expensive models
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to check the power consumption of things I'm building and check the output of power supplies. I saw no reason to buy the more expensive versions of this just to get a pretty OLED display. If I want an OLED display I'll just put one on my own stuff. The old fashioned seven segment display on this thing works just fine. Irregardless of what it might look like, it does display other information like power consumption and mAh charged so far, it just alternates the display depending on mode setting. If you don't need USB 3.0 for some strange reason, just buy this one. It does what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Omega ManTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Meter/Tester
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is a short cable to be able to turn it so you can read it easily. I purchased one before and liked it so I ordered two more as it is a nice tool to monitor USB current to check out cables or ports are the limiting factor to charging from a Power Bank or from a charger etc. I just used it today to check out 8 Usb flexible reading LED lights to see if they all a about the same current draw and Brightness and i found one that was not correct.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T.

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget/tool!
customer_reviews.text: Have tested many power cubes and adapters. Now I know a little more as to why the older ones weren’t charging our phones properly anymore. Also found some where the voltage was too high. Took one out of the electronics recycling box, too, but will keep an eye on it for now. Will definitely take while traveling, whenever that starts up again for us.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for charging stuff
customer_reviews.text: I use this to charge all my camera and phone batteries and other similar stuff. I can tell that the device is charging at the correct current and voltage. I found one source I have that had low voltage and therefore would not charge correctly to a full charge. I think this is a really good gadget for phone and camera users. I can monitor my charging for my Bluetooth speaker and other chargers, too. I also use it for charging my hearing aid personal amplifier. Useful.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Works well - Very handy to check USB with all the combined outlet and USB charger devices.
customer_reviews.text: In light of the prolific onslaught of USB and combined outlet / USB charging units, this device gives peace of mind especially if the unit you are checking is wall installed. Can also be used if a charging unit is thought to have failed. Instructions are a little vague but the unit has proved invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for testing USB ports
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for testing a new solar panel I bought for my camping trip. I don't have any calibration equipment, but I did test this meter on the solar panel, my PC, battery bank, and my car. It read right at what the specs were for the items I was plugging into. Only "down" side is that its IMPOSSIBLE to read in direct sun, ran into some issues with the solar panel test because I had to shade the meter so I could see it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for knowing how much power is being provided or used.
customer_reviews.text: Neat gadget for establishing how much power your device is drawing or how much power your wall-wart is kicking out. Helped determine which wall-warts were 2.1amp or just 1.0amp. High speed charging vs regular/low speed. Tablets and other large display devices need a 2.1(or 2.4 now)amp charger to charge while being used. This little nugget helped me show several people why that makes a difference when trying to charge and use a device that needs the higher amps.
customer_reviews.author: Michele L. Borgen

customer_reviews.title: RTFM sometimes does no good.
customer_reviews.text: The product performed well I think. By plugging it into a charger and attaching several devices I got what I hope are accurate voltage and amperage readings. I would have given this product 5 stars if it would have included a comprehensible manual. The manual appears to have been written in one language, then translated into another, then translated into English. (There might have been more iterations.) Here's an example: "This USB meter could only test the real-time voltage, current, electric power, and accumulated discharging capacitance,but not useful for increasing voltage, current, nor the function as being a dis-charge device" I am that oddity - a user who reads the manual. In this case, the manual provided no useful information.
customer_reviews.author: Californiano

customer_reviews.title: This tester could be better if it was able to test my other Samsung ...
customer_reviews.text: This tester could be better if it was able to test my other Samsung attached device, but it apperars that this device doesn't allow some of the signals to go to the device from higher quality charging bricks. Some chargers send signals to the battery or device this one wouldn't allow my Samsung charger block to start a charge, I had similar results from another tablet charging device. Perhaps there is something filtering out the signal??? This worked well enough for other devices connected to my solar panel when not testing the plug in charging bricks.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Moon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for testing USB cables, phone chargers, and wall adapters!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is likely one of the dumbest things you've ever seen. Why would you care how much power your USB plug was drawing? Who cares! That's dumb! BUT! What if you were trying to figure out which USB wall adapters you had were good enough to quick charge your phone? What about the portable batteries to see how much juice they could put out? What if you were trying to figure out how and why your phone was charging slow? Was it the cable? The wall adapter? Both?! Now you can figure all that out. Stupid. Genius. And if you like playing with microcontrollers, USB powered arduino boards/Raspberry Pi etc, then this thing is even MORE useful.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, manual is confusing
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says in the description. However, do note that the manual mentions "capacitance" which confused me at first until I realized that it was actually referring to capacity (mAh) which can be useful when charging a battery for instance, to determine it's actual vs. rated capacity.
customer_reviews.author: redneck

customer_reviews.title: This device will help you to know if your other devices are being charged or not...
customer_reviews.text: This device really is an eyeopener. Tried what was a 2000 mA charger - turns out the charger is a 500 mA charger. Oh well, the 500 mA will charge my Bluetooth headset but it will take a LONG time do charge my cell phone. So I use a charger that this device indicated was charging the cell phone at a VERY fast rate - about 9 volts at 1.7 Amps. This device will help let you know which USB chargers lie about their Amp ratings.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyCapsTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great way to trouble shoot charging issues on your devices.
customer_reviews.text: What a really cool tool! I used it to figure out why my phone was taking so long to charge. I plugged this between my charger adapter and the charging cord on my phone and was able to measure the Voltage and Amps coming from the charger. I found that with different charging cords I was able to get more Amps, or more Voltage (Fast Charging) out of the adapter. So where I had thought that my charger adapters weren't good my problem was actually the cords most of the time. Also, for durability, and charging speed, it seems you can't beat the flat USB Mini charging cables that you buy for a couple of bucks at the gas station.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Jones

customer_reviews.title: The instruction manual is written in English words but the grammar is so bad in the manual that i could not understand what ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what is says it does. Decent packaging. The instruction manual is written in English words but the grammar is so bad in the manual that i could not understand what they were trying to get across. I quote directly from the instruction manual; "there are numerous accumulation of charging capacitance when continuously powering on". I don't know what that means or is supposed to mean.
customer_reviews.author: Nodak

customer_reviews.title: Great item and very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It just works and works well. Using this device, I can easily tell if one of my charging cables is crap or going bad, I can tell how much current a device is using so I know if something is wrong, and I can tell if the voltage is out of spec on one of my many chargers. It is an easy to use and "must have" device, so I bought some for friends, too. I have been using it for over a year without any problems, even when left plugged in (in-line) for many months at a time.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to test my MacBook's USB ports
customer_reviews.text: I had a suspicion that my MacBook Pro was frying USB devices on one of its ports. I bought this tester to confirm this. Using a USB to USB-C adapter, it worked like a charm and showed nearly 20V coming from one of the USB-C ports on my laptop! I'm sure I'll find other uses for it, but it served its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little meter
customer_reviews.text: This meter does what I hoped it would do. I had some USB chargers that seemed to charge differently with different devices. Using this meter I was able to see that the chargers were not delivering the expected amperage . I have trashed a couple of chargers and purchased some new ones. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: KKid

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to use. Accurate too.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very useful for checking power quality coming from several usb chargers. Indeed it clearly showed one if my 60w chargers was failing when devices were connected. With this easy to read usb volt meter I was able to see the voltage of the charger was dropping to below 4.5v which was causing havoc with charging. Voltage matches my high end multimeter but is easier to use
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great value and very handy
customer_reviews.text: I got this to check my lightening cables and usb power adapters for charging my mobile devices. It seems to work great. Instructions were a little hard to understand, but I think I got it. It'd be nice if they simply said in plain language what all the readouts mean, but still good. I just got new cables and checked them all to make sure they're working and all's good. Old ones show lower amp output. Seems fine and customer care seems great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful.
customer_reviews.text: The device does exactly what it is advertised to do although I'm not sure about the usefulness of measuring capacitance. The explanation of this measurement is not explained very well in the directions that came with the unit. Output number 1 does allow the bi directional flow of data unimpeded but Output number two only allows for the measurement of charging current and voltage and does not allow data to pass at all. If two devices are plugged into the meter at the same time, the combined amperage used by both devices and the voltage shared by them is what is displayed. I would have given 5 stars had the capacitance question been more clearly explained in the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J.

customer_reviews.title: Did you ever wonder if your USB device was really ...
customer_reviews.text: Did you ever wonder if your USB device was really charging or, if it has only a light, how much it is charging. This little puppy will answer your questions for just a few bucks. It tells me more than I really need (as is the case with many electronic gadgets these days, but the volts and amps are the key. The other thing I found interesting was that the gadget only pulls less than 20 milliamps.. The only negative is the Chinese English in the little users manual but I'm getting so used to it that it almost makes sense to me!
customer_reviews.author: eddalex

customer_reviews.title: Must have.
customer_reviews.text: Must have if you use power bank to charge your device. If you curious about how much voltages and amperage drawing from any female USB port. I used this all the time when charging my phones or Ipad from power bank. At least it tell me my power bank working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon510

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these units after trying a friends on a bike trip. I really, really like these because they have a duel read-out for volts and amps being taken by whatever you are trying to charge...so you finally KNOW if the charger is connected and working instantly! No more wondering and no surprises after a night on the charger and NO charge to your device. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED and well worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Stick60

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I had a USB device that kept shorting out power banks and other USB power sources. This little tool here let me know what was wrong!(Pulling too many amps) It's accurate and easy to read. A must have for anyone that has a lot of tech.
customer_reviews.author: MrTaylorM

customer_reviews.title: Really nice USB power meter
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up partly because I need it and partly because is nice looking: score on both. Especially useful for the current readout, the readout is large and bright. I actually haven't looked into the load it adds to the USB bus, I imagine its not very much. If you are doing some device making, along with it working, you'll want to know what it draws; this will make quick work of that.
customer_reviews.author: Bud O.

customer_reviews.title: Bought to test USB cables and ports
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased to test my USB ports and cables. So far I have discovered a bad port on one of my laptop's, and abad OEM phone cable. This is not the expensive meter but hands down it does everything it is supposed to at a fraction of the price. It comes in a cut out foam holder, for storage. It is well made from what I see and it reads proper measurements. I will be buying another to keep in my computer tool box soon. Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Billyk

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: The meter is very well made and the accuracy is good ( less than 2% error ) when I compared it to a pro grade multi-meter. The only issue is one of the red digital numeric LED can flicker or dim when transitioning from 6 to 7 to 8. The other LEDs do not do this. This is the only niggle but one I find annoying
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Works well and does what was expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works well with all of my chargers and USB outlets (displays reasonable values for voltage and current). Output II works with my iPhone 6s when attached to a DC charger. I didn't have any android devices with which to test it, but I will update the review if this fails when I get a chance. Using this in my 2016 Civic freaked out CarPlay, as no data was passed using either port, but both ports charged my iPhone and measured voltage and current. Car entertainment system required reboot after use, so I will not use this in my car again. With output 1, I can pass data and charge my phone on the computer, with output 2 it only charges.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: You need this if you have a bunch of chargers.
customer_reviews.text: This is something you NEED if you have a lot of chargers. I have accumulated with kids and wife, etc over 20 of them. And with this I found that 7 were defective. I thought they had become so, but it is difficult to test without putting them under a load like this allows you to do. It will also test if the charger has the ability to put out MORE than the 1amp standard USB, because many new phone allow a lot more (2A) and many allow higher voltage (such as my LG V20).
customer_reviews.author: S. W. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Drok? Dreck?
customer_reviews.text: Drok? Dreck? Nice display, but it read 5.20 volts at first and then shifted to 4.3 volts and stayed there. No matter where I plugged it in, and even when a second tester plugged into it showed the USB voltage was 5.19 volts. So, wildly inaccurate right out of the box and no way to tell that. No way to guess if that also affected the amperage display, so back it went. Also, the cord is twisted, making it hard to read the display when the USB plug is right side up--you have to hold the Drok "face up" because of the twist.
customer_reviews.author: Some Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Success!
customer_reviews.text: Know I know which of my usb cords work and which don't. I also found that my tablet doesn't always charge when it should and that I may need to unplug it and plug it back in a couple times before it shows that it is charging. Very handy device for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: JagLite

customer_reviews.title: You probably don't know you need this...
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of those "missing tools" of the Millennial generation. A hardware solution to measure a bunch of stuff about the power being supplied by you USB source. In addition to the expected V and A, you get capacitance, and - really helpful - power. You never thing about this until you're wondering why a phone takes forever to charge, or that nothing plugged into you car USB works. For just a few bucks you can find out for sure in an instant what's going on. You may not use this very often, but if you've got it in your E-box, it beats the hell out of using a DVM and pin probes.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Brennan

customer_reviews.title: A device you never realize how valuable it can be for evaluating your electronics tools.
customer_reviews.text: Since I received two of these meters, I find myself connecting them almost 100% of the time when charging devices. They are very informative and I also purchased a adjustable load to use with these meters. I checked a lot of reviews before buying the Drok meter. If you used caution to not overload the meter, you will get a lot of good service from it. I highly recommend this meter. Thanks, Ted
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Bought this after paying twice as much at Frys.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this model is that it doesn't show you that one of the ports is configured for privacy / power only. That is the entire reason I purchased these devices (additional). I charge my USB power bank on port 1, and my iPhone on port 2. This phone also helps you ensure you are getting over 1Amp to feed your hungry devices. When borrowing my kids usb in the kitchen, I incidentally identified that my family members were using undersized 110/USB adapters and upgraded them to 2.1A USBs. Until an iPhone hits 80% it needs more than 1AMP for optimal charging.
customer_reviews.author: amazing cust

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This updates the values very quickly, as in, it feels instant. As far as I can tell, the accuracy is great. It's totally work the cost to see how good your charger and cable set ups really are. I learned phones slow charging speeds when screen is on, which I assume is to keep the battery cool. Maximum charging numbers should be read while the phone has the screen off or is in locked position. I've had it for awhile and it's still doing great. Don't let the price fool ya, take advantage of it, instead.
customer_reviews.author: AllThingsTech

customer_reviews.title: I find this to be a major drawback for users like me who don't need all the fancy measurements the ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it specifically to check the out put from various USB chargers with Micro-USB Male ends. Then I found that there was no built-in way to check all those devices. So I connected an adapter allowing me to hook to a Micro-USB cable. It clearly showed the Wattage on all of them. But I still cannot decipher where to find the output Amperage for the cables. I find this to be a major drawback for users like me who don't need all the fancy measurements the device is supposed to make.So if you're buying one as I intended to use it - find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Display, Good Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great little device for seeing how much power your USB devices are using. I had a KCX-017 before, but decided to get a DROK as well. Love the DROK's bright display and ability to monitor capacitance and power as well as a few other things. One of the outputs is for charging only, which is nice if you don't want to deal with any data issues. One thing they could add is the ability to display how much current has passed through the device like the KCX-017, but I suppose you can't have everything in one :-) I really brought it for the display though. Love those bright LEDs.
customer_reviews.author: Vik

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Just suddenly stopped functioning properly It is expected to last much longer than this
customer_reviews.author: Partially Biased Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of kit!
customer_reviews.text: This tester is very useful and a quality product. I believe Drok makes the best of the rest. The others although slightly cheaper, are not up to the same level of standards. My came a bit disassembled. The end opposite the plug was not seated all the way. A mere squeeze and all was well. There were white marks in the same area which covered with black permanent marker. No big deal. Works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: cool and I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea this item existed and find it interesting to see my phones charging and how much amperage they draw while doing so. It's an inexpensive way to see things as they happen. I bought it at the same time I bought a solar charger and it helped me realize that model wasn't giving an output until it was in bright sunlight. I was able to ask that seller informed questions which then allowed me to return an item that didn't work for my needs. The device is small, well made and well, cool and I recommend it. It's an affordable addition to my toolbox and I just love having tools.
customer_reviews.author: SFC USA, Ret

customer_reviews.title: Nice little device.
customer_reviews.text: Great little device. Necessary to check on cables if they are of good quality. Also helpful to put between chargers in hotel rooms and airports to prevent data snooping. Port two only provides power and no dat connection that helps in this regard. Useful to see if the USB ports on a device are up to spec.
customer_reviews.author: MaheraTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: This meter could have saved me a lot of money.
customer_reviews.text: It's interesting and informative to be able to check inexpensive chargers to see that they provide stable and accurate power. I have ruined the display (black spot in the middle of the display) on one iPod touch by leaving it powered by a radio as a now questionable power supply. I plan to test each of my plug-in chargers to determine if any non-Apple chargers I have provide too high a voltage as the radio obviously does. I also damaged a $500 set of motorcycle communication headsets with an incorrect power source connected to my motorcycle's battery. This inexpensive device could have saved me that frustration as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Gibbons

customer_reviews.title: Great little passthrough meter!
customer_reviews.text: The meter arrived in a reusable tin container, unfortunately dented badly in shipping. However, the meter itself was protected. This meter gets the basics right, measuring voltage, current. It also measures power and capacitance (press the tiny button to change what it displays). I like that I can measure two devices together, but I wish it also gave their individual measurements. The included instruction card was for a different product, so that was useless. The dual readouts for voltage and current were very easy to read and distinguish by color. I learned some new things by using this, and I recommend it for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: MusashiAharon

customer_reviews.title: Fun and versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: love this little unit. works perfectly every time. it's nice to be able to see how much current different devices draw when they're being charged. and for ones that don't have a charging icon like cell phones do, it tells you when the device is fully charged, when the current goes down to a trickle. bought mostly to use with a 18650 USB battery charger that doesn't have a capacity function. I just hope it doesn't burn out like cheap electronics tend to do. the meters like this with the pigtail USB cable are also more useful then the flash drive type ones. fun little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little USB tester, well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this USB voltage tester! It helped me determine what was going on with my Surface, by showing there was no power coming out of it. It also works well to test your chargers and see what they're actually putting out to your phone/device!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Stonehill

customer_reviews.title: Helps you see the world of difference!
customer_reviews.text: There is a world of difference among charging blocks, USB ports, and cables. Some charge fast and some charge very slow. This device lets you know what is working well and what you should throw away. It's incredibly helpful if you are interested in charging devices in a hurry and you want to take the guess work out.
customer_reviews.author: R. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Really useful
customer_reviews.text: It's really useful to be able to see what kind of current a USB charger is supplying. This thing is simple to use and really easy to read with the bright LED light-segment numbers. Bought a second one of these so that I could monitor two chargers at the same time. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Reliable but not so friendly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Product seems sturdy and reliable but instructions and/or usefulness should be explained in a more simple way. Maybe product is to be used by experienced technicians but some if us just buy it to find out which chargers work faster and better than others, but this is not easy to understand unless you have technical knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Mario S

customer_reviews.title: NICE GADGET!!
customer_reviews.text: quality meter, works as stated, bright clear display, scrolling through modes feature is nice. this meter can keep track of how much amp hour your usb battery bank is really putting out, you would be surprised how many are way overrating the battery bank capacity. also shows you in watts or P for power which is the same, can log 99.999 amp hours, will hold the reading if your battery shuts off. next time you plug the meter in it will show you the amp hours of the last test. hold the button for a few seconds and it will reset.
customer_reviews.author: toolman1275678

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright readout
customer_reviews.text: This nice little unit is perfect for checking both built in USB ports on PC's and wall brick USB adapters. No more guessing to see if they are actually out putting voltage, plus it gives you an approximation of how much amperage is being delivered as well. The digital readout is nice and bright, and bi colored to differentiate between the voltage and amperage. Overall, a great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: RCM

customer_reviews.title: Both worked just fine. I have several different types of these testers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these USB testers. Both worked just fine. I have several different types of these testers. This was the first time I purchased a model with a pigtail lead. It is very nice to have it. Also, this is the first tester I've used that shows voltage and current at the same time. Othjers alternate between voltage and current. That's also a nice feature. Each tester has 2 USB outputs so you can measure two items at one time. I compared their readings and both show the identical voltage and current. My simple testing showed that each tester itself draws about 10 ma. I would recommend this tester.
customer_reviews.author: Donald S.

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment, worked perfectly out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great entertainment, worked perfectly out of the box, had clear English instructions included with the device. (Not that it's that complicated). I've used this to evaluate the truthfulness of smart phone and tablet charging devices so I can confidently pick the best ones that actually deliver top charging power to my devices. A car charger or USB Adapter may say 2 amps at 5 Volts on the sticker, but half of them (So far tested) are lying to us, both in amps output and voltage stability. This unit can help sniff those out for you so you get the fastest best charger for your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Cooke

customer_reviews.title: I'm a dork for this Drok!
customer_reviews.text: Way cool multi-tool! It's like driving a car with an RPM tach: you don't NEED it, but it is pretty handy to accurately know what's happening under the hood. I got the basic LED version with 7 modes and big red and blue digits. PROS: + very easy to read + very easy to use + multi screen readout (two values at once) + can display mAh used over time (not just instantaneous V, A or Watts) I'm a dork for this Drok!
customer_reviews.author: Chad P.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a device to tell me when a charging block and/or cable is not working. This device does that. It helped me identify that my charging block was bad and that the problem was not with the cable or the phone. I have no idea how accurate it is because I honestly do not have a way to check that. Also, I don't know why it would want us to rate charging power, because the device is not used to charge other devices. Overall, it's an inexpensive device to save you a lot of frustration. Get one (or at least have a friend get one)..
customer_reviews.author: Sneakymom

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a must tool since buying phone chargers from different sources can be a problem. Use it all the time when getting a new phone charger to check voltage output of chargers.
customer_reviews.author: JCD

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: This little device is incredble. It enables you to troubleshoot any USB port. What I really wanted it for was to confirm that my higher power 10W/12W chargers are actually able to output the higher current, and it enables me to verify what chargers are limited to just 5W. I recommend this device to any troubleshooters or those curious as to what their chargers are putting out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hess

customer_reviews.title: I have no calibration data for this but at least the measurements seemed to be in the ball park - good enough for the kids anywa
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a elementary school science project, to measure the charge coming out of a bicycle dynamo and into an iPhone. Kids collected voltage, amperage and power data for about one hour. I have no calibration data for this but at least the measurements seemed to be in the ball park - good enough for the kids anyway. I am subtracting one star because while in power measurement mode, the display gets occasionally stuck at 0.4W
customer_reviews.author: Vasile Nistor

customer_reviews.title: which works great for me too
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what I needed it to do. It allowed me to test all hub-cable combinations from my devices, allowed me to know the range amperage pulled by each of my devices. Now I can choose more smartly which chargers to use to achieve faster charging for all my devices together (let's say I have two hours to go on a trip and need to fill all of my devices as much as possible). I've understood why some combinations weren't working as expected. It also works to use one hub and charge two low amperage devices at the same time, which works great for me too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use it mostly to check USB chargers for proper operation under load. It's a cinch, just plug the meter into the charger and plug the device into the meter. I have not tried to use the "capacity" (total energy consumed over a period of time) measurement features.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Copp

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: A very handy little device. I use it to measure the output of wall chargers to see how they perform. It is also handy for measuring the state of charge on devices, like a iPod Touch, that do not tell you when they are fully charged. I monitor the charge rate and unplug it when the amperage drops off. This avoids overcharging the device, which shortens battery life. Compact, inexpensive and easy to use. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: JBM 63

customer_reviews.title: DROK - Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: DROK makes unique & cool stuff of excellent quality at an extremely reasonable price. Nice to have items for someone that is techno minded, into electronics at the hobbyist level or just wants to see the measurements to further understand circuit function. Because of it's small size and solid contruction you can actually build an electronics toolkit in a small cigar box or your jacket pocket. I'll definitely be back for more cool tools as they create them and my specific need suits the purchase. This is the second item I have purchased and I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AKsmitty

customer_reviews.title: A big time saver in diagnosing a power issue.
customer_reviews.text: I received this Saturday and have not used this as of yet. I work at an RV service center and needed something like this last week. A coworker had this same tool, this tool is awesome. I was looking for a power loss on a USB plug in a couch. It definitely helped find the problem. Definitely would recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Cool device to check how a charger or USB cable is working
customer_reviews.text: This gave me the information I needed to know which usb wires are good and which suck. Any usb cables over 5 feet is not worth buying. I was able to see how the adaptive fast chargers work, cool!
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: Great! Just works! Great price too!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, better than the charger doctor one, it feels and looks a lot sturdier and is solidly constructed. Does the job it's meant to do accurately and easily. Anyone can use this to quickly see the voltage and amperage of a usb charger or usb port. Note: amperage requires a usb device to be plugged into one of the two usb out ports via USB cable (not included). Edit: I'm just now noticing that there appear to be functions other than just Voltage and Amperage, not sure exactly what they are, trying to look for a manual to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Braden D.

customer_reviews.title: I'd never really know what happened or how I could be using the panels better.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty adapter that really begins to give you some visibility as to what power draw your various USB devices have. I purchased two of these to help monitor energy generation/consumption for USB solar panels. There's something very satisfying watching the numbers as the sun charges my USB power banks and to see "how high can I get it" by orienting the solar panels toward the sun as the day goes on. Without these testers, I'd never really know what happened or how I could be using the panels better.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M.

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I recieved was a dud, but the replacement works fine. The model I ordered has power and capacitence display options in addition to voltage and current. Other devices being sold look the same, but don't have the extra functions. My only concern is that the construction of the device seems to be for light duty use, but at the $10 price range this is a good value. This device will work well for checking/comparing the output of usb chargers when connected to a phone, tablet, or other device that draws less than 3A. The spec sheet indicates that the meter can even be used to briefly measure current between 3 - 10A. Use caution with that.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: A nerd's joy
customer_reviews.text: Really useful stuff! The Voltage reading will be esp. useful in my case to determine the best orientation of my portable solar chargers (in batteries and adapters it should always read around 5V, so no mystery there). More interestingly, getting the current in amps is a great way to see the power needs of devices and whether the adapter/battery can deliver the necessary power. Finally, checking the real mAh of batteries is the dorkiest way to make me happy. I couldn't ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: Oskar Pineño

customer_reviews.title: Great training/teaching tool as I found out many devices charge ...
customer_reviews.text: Never knew how handy this would be until I ordered it! Great training/teaching tool as I found out many devices charge better/worse depending on how well seated the connector is into the device charging. Note that the Output II (at least on my device) does not work as well as Output I... Not sure if it is just mine or all like this, but if you aren't getting the Amperage reading you think you should try the other Output... Also amazed at how much better some cords are than others. Note that Amperage can be limited by the charging device or the cord, and few devices actually charge at the theoretical Amperage, but great cord and connection tester/trainer. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: So far the product works fine. The main reason I bought this is to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far the product works fine. The main reason I bought this is to test amps or watts going to usb powered products and test capacity of power banks and car jump starters. The reason for the lukewarm rating is the lack of a usable manual (I tried to look on the DROK website), using the word "capacitance" for "amp hour" which had me staring at the the thing for a bit until I read a review that explained what I suspected and helped me understand the display which is not clear at all. Maybe I should have tried one of the ones with the OLED displays. Thanks, Alex
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice for confirming that a USB charger is working and how much current a device being charged draws.
customer_reviews.text: As others have pointed out the instruction are difficult to interpret. The term "capacitance" is used several times,I suspect they mean watt hours or amp hours.
customer_reviews.author: paul m ledoux

customer_reviews.title: It's simple, it works, it's cheap - great pickup!
customer_reviews.text: As far as I'm concerned, this is a five-star item. There isn't very much to it - it doesn't provide tons of detail, but it does provide exactly the information it claims in the description, and it would be hard to find a less expensive, easy to use tool of its kind. I used it to check the multiple charger adapters and cords floating around our house. The results explained a lot of our charging troubles. we had a couple of bad cables and a few sketchy adapters. I expect less surprises a few hours after plugging in from now on. I wish I had bought this little gadget a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: J. Herbst

customer_reviews.title: Neat unit - not for capacitance
customer_reviews.text: Neat little unit. One error in the description/instructions is that you don’t need to measure the capacitance (farads) of a USB port, that I know of. From the reading I see on the ‘C’ setting, I believe this is the ‘Capacity’ or total mah received by the unit over the charge time. Not sure how useful this is. Charging voltage and amperage are the 2 readings important to me. I currently have no way to verify this unit’s accuracy – the readings seem reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy D.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This tool is indispensable for monitoring the charge process of Android or Apple phones and tablets. Very quick response. Seems accurate. Good quality display and connectors. Comes with adequate instructions that explain the three display functions (voltage/current, instantaneous power, and charge capacity) and two output ports (pass through or managed power output).
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Short version: I have no idea why there are 2 USB ports. But it does what I need it to, measuring current so I can see what all my various chargers are delivering to my devices. Long version: USB charging is a mess. Not only do you have all these chargers rated for different output, even the cables (!) matter. Yes, with the same device plugged into the same USB charger, the cable can make a huge difference in how much current gets through, and ultimately how long it takes to charge. use this to measure and know how good your chargers and cables really are.
customer_reviews.author: microeye

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this one because it is a cable connection not just a flat large usb that may not work on certain plugs which is nice. Reads great Must have for all repair techs
customer_reviews.author: Those Guys Electronicz

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to own.
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver when it comes to testing what a USB port is actually providing in regards to both volts and amps. I was able to determine that a few of my USB cigarette lighter socket chargers were not supplying enough amps to properly charge the battery in my Samsung Galaxy J7 cell phone. I highly recommend this product, along with a DROK Micro Battery Load Tester Detector.
customer_reviews.author: AirJohn

customer_reviews.title: Nice display.
customer_reviews.text: Only connects to USB 2/3. Wanted to test the output from the male micro USB fitting on the end of the charger cables. No micro socket or micro to male USB 2/3 adapter. Appears to work well if you have the correct connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Al Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this USB meter
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of other meters from DROK and have had limited success, but this one works great. It has some different features in the display compared to the others, but the charging compatibility is perfect for my Galaxy S4 phone. Samsung devices tend to be very picky about chargers, and putting a meter in between to test the current draw can make the phone behave differently. Not with this meter; it works perfectly. I am currently using it with a solar panel to keep track of how well the panel is positioned for charging my phone and tablet and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Must have! Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of faulty USB cables and re-assigned correct charger for device. Also, checked the efficiency of power banks, car chargers. Amazing device! Gives correct reading when connected to QC fast charger. Engineers delight! When you test cable or charger make sure the device is low on battery so that you can get reading on full power as charging trickles down on devices that have nearly full power.
customer_reviews.author: Ghenghiz

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable instrument for an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Has all the vital parameters for monitoring the charging of a device via USB. USB is used to charge some expensive devices. Knowing what is actually passing over the wires can be invaluable and avoid catastrophically overcharging. $10 is well worth the peace of mind. I find the ability to measure capacity to be particularly useful for detecting a weak battery which can explain why your smartphone is no longer performing well. With an instrument that costs a fraction of a new battery.
customer_reviews.author: Go mexico

customer_reviews.title: If replacing cable doesn't fix problem, Use This to diagnose.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is useful for diagnosing USB power problems. If your USB device is not charging this will tell you if you have a bad cable or connector or a bad charger or a bad battery. I did not test accuracy and this device alone is not capable of charging, it requires an external charger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I use these to measure volts and current coming from portable solar panels. Works for my intended usage, not sure about the other features.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this. I'm no electronics technician. I just wanted to see what it took to charge my powerbanks and what various usb adapters were actually putting out.. I use a portable solar collector to charge the powerbanks while camping and have also installed a couple usb ports in the back of my truck that are connected to the 12 volt truck battery. This meter shows me the voltage and amperage being passed into the power banks from the usb ports as they charge. Great information! Easy to read and compact and easy to pack away to be used anywhere anytime.
customer_reviews.author: The Beach Guy
